event.doc_name: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

evidence.text: Due to Mississippi's failure to properly fund, staff, and maintain its prisons, Plaintiffs are currently being confined in conditions which pose serious and imminent dangers to their safety and well-being.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: Mississippi's failure to properly fund, staff, and maintain prisons leading to dangerous conditions

evidence.text: The shortage of correctional officers on staff at Parchman creates and enables an environment in which the inmates at Parchman are particularly susceptible to violence, gang influence, and prolonged states of anarchy.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: Shortage of correctional officers enabling violence and gang influence at Parchman

evidence.text: Since January 1, 2020, at least nine inmates have died at Parchman, and at least two other inmates have escaped from Parchman.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: Nine inmate deaths and two escapes at Parchman since January 1, 2020

evidence.text: Parchman is so severely underfunded that inmates are routinely denied access to basic amenities such as clean water, plumbing, and electricity. A slew of disturbing images and videos have surfaced showing that inmates are being required to defecate in plastic bags inside of their cells because their toilets are not functional.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: Denial of basic amenities including clean water, functional plumbing, and electricity

evidence.text: In Parchman, the units are subject to flooding. Black mold festers. Rats and mice infest the prison. Units lack running water and electricity for days at a time.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: Overcrowding, flooding, black mold, rats, and lack of running water/electricity

evidence.text: At the end of October 2019, the staffing ratio at Parchman (12.5 prisoners per correctional officer) was worse than Alabama's.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: Staffing ratio of 12.5 prisoners per correctional officer at Parchman (worse than Alabama's 9.9)

evidence.text: A 2019 Mississippi Department of Health inspection of Parchman found 'more than 400 cells with problems such as flooding and leaks, lack of lights, power and water, broken toilets and sinks as well as missing pillows and mattresses.'
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint and Demand for Jury Trial

add_extracted.value: 2019 health inspection found over 400 cells with environmental hazards

args.reason: All checklist items are fully extracted (Factual_Basis_of_Case has 7 distinct values from fully visited document). No further documents need to be processed.

All checklist items (Factual_Basis_of_Case) are fully extracted with 7 distinct values from the fully visited Class Action Complaint document. No further documents need processing as the item is complete.
